title: Getting Started with Node.js
content:
# Node.js Basics
Learn how Node.js works and why it’s powerful for backend apps.

title: Mastering Express Middleware
content:
## Middleware in Express
Middleware helps intercept requests and responses in Express apps.

title: Understanding MongoDB Aggregations
content:
### Aggregations
MongoDB aggregations allow advanced data processing using pipelines.

title: React Hooks Deep Dive
content:
#### useState & useEffect
React hooks simplify state management and side effects.

title: Building REST APIs with TypeScript
content: Learn how to build a REST API with Express and TypeScript for strong typing.

title: GraphQL vs REST: When to Use What
content: GraphQL offers flexibility, while REST is simple. Let’s compare.

title: Authentication with JWT
content: JWT provides a stateless way to handle authentication in web apps.

title: Optimizing React Performance
content: React provides memoization and lazy loading to optimize rendering.

title: Next.js for Beginners
content: Next.js makes server-side rendering easy and scalable.

title: Dockerizing Your Node.js App
content: Docker allows containerization of Node.js apps for consistent deployment.

title: CI/CD with GitHub Actions
content: Automate build and deployment pipelines using GitHub Actions.

title: Handling File Uploads in Express
content: Use multer or busboy to handle file uploads in Node.js Express apps.

title: State Management with Redux Toolkit
content: Redux Toolkit simplifies state management with less boilerplate.

title: Testing APIs with Jest & Supertest
content: Learn to test REST APIs effectively using Jest and Supertest.

title: Deploying Apps on Vercel
content: Vercel offers fast and easy frontend deployment for React & Next.js.

title: Server-Side Rendering with React
content: SSR improves SEO and initial load performance for React apps.

title: Securing APIs with Rate Limiting
content: Protect your APIs from abuse using rate limiting middleware.

title: Introduction to WebSockets
content: WebSockets allow real-time bidirectional communication between client & server.

title: Microservices Architecture Explained
content: Microservices split apps into smaller services for scalability.

title: Caching with Redis
content: Redis provides fast in-memory caching for improving performance.
